title: AI minister says OpenAI still not doing enough in wake of B.C. shooting, will meet CEO Altman
description: Artificial Intelligence Minister Evan Solomon says OpenAI's recent commitments to adjust its policies in the wake of the shooting in Tumbler Ridge, B.C., do not go far enough and plans to meet with CEO Sam Altman.
content:
Artificial Intelligence Minister Evan Solomon says OpenAI's recent commitments to adjust its policies in the wake of the shooting in Tumbler Ridge, B.C., do not go far enough and plans to meet with CEO Sam Altman.

title: Trumps directs all federal agencies to stop using AI company Anthropic's technology
description: Trump's directive comes amid a feud ⁠between the Pentagon and top artificial ⁠intelligence lab Anthropic over concerns about how ⁠the ⁠military ​could use AI at war.
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on ‌Friday said he was directing every federal agency to immediately cease all use ​of Anthropic's technology, adding there ​would be a six-month phase out for agencies ​such as the Defense Department who ⁠use the ⁠company... [507 chars]

title: Trump tells all federal agencies to drop Anthropic tech
description: A public showdown between the Trump administration and Anthropic is hitting an impasse as military officials demand the artificial intelligence company bend its ethical policies by Friday or risk damaging its business.

title: February's Financial Turmoil: Stocks Plummet Amid Investor Jitters
description: The U.S. stock market faced significant declines in February due to concerns over artificial intelligence, tariffs, and geopolitical tensions. Financial and tech stocks suffered the most, with key indexes dropping sharply. Defensive sectors performed better, while hotter inflation data weakened hopes of a dovish Federal Reserve policy.
content: Financial and tech stocks in the U.S. were heavily impacted on Friday, leading to the largest monthly decline in a year. Major indexes posted steep weekly declines, driven by artificial intelligence uncertainties, revived tariff concerns, and geopoli... [735 chars]

title: Anthropic refuses to bend to Pentagon on AI safeguards as dispute nears deadline
description: A public showdown between the Trump administration and Anthropic is hitting an impasse as military officials demand the artificial intelligence company bend its ethical policies by Friday or risk damaging its business
content:
WASHINGTON — WASHINGTON (AP) — A public showdown between the Trump administration and Anthropic is hitting an impasse as military officials demand the artificial intelligence company bend its ethical policies by Friday or risk damaging its business.

title: Bell invests $1M in UNB McKenna Institute
description: A shortage in artificial intelligence and cybersecurity experts has led to a partnership between the University of New Brunswick and Bell Cyber to better train more students in the evolving digital age.

title: US Bars Anthropic Products From Agencies, Contractors
description: The Pentagon declared Anthropic PBC a supply-chain risk after President Donald Trump directed US government agencies to stop using its products, capping a feud between the artificial intelligence giant and defense officials over safeguards on its technology.

title: Eby credits OpenAI for coming clean after mass killings in Tumbler Ridge, B.C.
description: B.C. Premier David Eby is crediting artificial intelligence firm OpenAI for not trying to hide problematic interactions between the Tumbler Ridge shooter and its chatbot.
content:
